intro: Hedysarum kuhitangi, commonly known as the Kuhitangi sweet pea, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its climbing habit and trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in native forests and along stream margins. Hedysarum kuhitangi plays a role in nitrogen fixation, contributing to soil fertility in its natural habitat.
